comments:
Installed the new release of BIRT (2.1RC0) hoping it would fix the error that occurs when trying to view an html/pdf report in a separate window (using Weblogic 8.1 it failed - fine on Tomcat 5.5.16 - qa dept said did not work on tomcat 5.5.9).  icu4j also has a new release (icu4j_3_4_4.jar) - it made no difference.  We tried extracting the icu jar into the classes directory and removing from lib - but it only worked 1x - after that we still had a problem with the display.  I have not tried installing on Weblogic 9 yet - not sure that would matter anyway since our customers have to agree to upgrade their environments.

Related links:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=128595
http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/incoming?id=5089;page=2;user=guest

The issue still remains:

see comments added to icu bug 5089 re: com.ibm.icu.impl.TimeZoneAdapter.inDaylightTime(java.util.Date): 

http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/incoming?id=5089;page=2;user=guest
This is an ICU/Weblogic bug, please reassign to viewer team until ICU fixes it.

Once icu team fix this issue, we will try to get the new icu4j.jar and attach it to this bugzilla entry.

We will add a readme/deployment note in viewer root folder to link to this bugzilla entry as a kown issue with weblogic. schedule to RC4 for adding this new readme file.

User can take the new icu4j.jar to replace the one from Eclipse to address this issue until the ICU fix finds its way into the Eclipse distribution.

After more investigation and feedback from icu team, it looks more like a 
weblogic issue. Even a simple war application with the icu.jar that instantiate 
one icu class will have similar problems: no jsp page can be loaded. It seems 
weblogic uses the icu class loaded by the web application instead of its own 
when extracting the jsp file from the war file. I opened case 654585 with BEA.

Follow up on BEA case 654585:

BEA is able to reproduce the issue, and has filed a CR (patch request) for 
their DEV team to find a permanent fix for the issue. The CR number is 282362.
